PickPocketFailed.synopsis:
Player tried to pickpocket an NPC but got caught.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim or a witness of the crime.

Vandalise.synopsis:
A player damaged or destroyedf an item owned by an NPC, and an NPC (the owner or someone else) witnessed this and stops the player by starting this dialog.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim (= owner) or a witness of the crime.

Theft.synopsis:
A player stole something, an NPC witness this act, and starts this dialog with the player
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim or a witness of the crime.
Theft.how_to_trigger: Steal something in view of an NPC.

KnockSpell.synopsis: A player used a knock spell, and the NPC saw the player when they did so, and immediately reacts to the player.

UseForbiddenItem.synopsis:
A player used an item owned by an NPC, and an NPC (the owner or someone else) witnessed this and stops the player by starting this dialog.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim (= owner) or a witness of the crime.
UseForbiddenItem.how_to_trigger: Use a forbidden item in sight of its NPC owner.

MovedCorpse.synopsis: An NPC reacts to a player moving a corpse of another NPC to which they are allied or neutral (i.e., not enemy).

MessWithCorpse.synopsis: An NPC reacts to a player interfering with a corpse of another NPC to which they are allied or neutral (i.e., not enemy). This is used for any other kind of interference besides looting and moving the corpse (those have custom dialogues). Example: casting Animate Dead on a corpse.
MessWithCorpse.how_to_trigger: Cast Animate Dead on the corpse of an NPC while another NPC allied or neutral to the dead one is nearby.

Trespassing.synopsis: A player got spotted by an NPC as they were trespassing.

DisarmingTrap.synopsis: A player got caught trying to disarm a trap.
DisarmingTrap.how_to_trigger: Disarm a trap while an NPC sees you

LockPicking.synopsis: A player got caught trying to lockpick an item.
LockPicking.how_to_trigger: Lockpick an item while an NPC sees you

PlacedTrap.synopsis: This triggers when an NPC detects the player has placed a Rune of Warding. Those include the sleep and thunder ones. The NPC must have succeeded in a skill check in order to notice this, and will then react to the player.
PlacedTrap.how_to_trigger: roll amazingaddDebugSpell Target_GlyphOfWardingcast the spell on/near an NPC

Assault.synopsis:
A player attacked an NPC, an NPC saw the player when they did so, and immediately reacts to the player.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim or a witness of the crime.

TeleportPlayer.synopsis: An NPC was speaking with a player, and then the player got teleported "far" away from the NPC, but still in their sight range. At that point, the dialog gets stopped and the NPC starts this dialog.

PickPocketFailed_0.speaker: GROUP_Bugbear, GROUP_Constructs, GROUP_Daisy, GROUP_Demons, GROUP_Desire, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Gnolls, GROUP_Gnomes, GROUP_Goblins, GROUP_HalfElves, GROUP_Halflings, GROUP_Hobgoblin, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Ogres, GROUP_Origins, GROUP_SmartUndead, GROUP_Tiefling, GROUP_Trolls
PickPocketFailed_0.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

PickPocketFailed_5.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketFailed_5.text: *How unfortunate. You'll need to prove you're a better fighter than you are a pickpocket.*

PickPocketFailed_1.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketFailed_1.text: *Your pickpocketing has ended in failure - and a raised alarm.*

PickPocketFailed_4.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketFailed_4.text: *Caught red-handed. Perhaps you should practise on a mannequin, or a corpse.*

Vandalise_1.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_1.text: *It seems you owe compensation for the item you just damaged.* ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Vandalise_15.speaker: Player
Vandalise_15.text: All right, I'll pay for it.

Vandalise_17.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_17.text: *You never knew vandalism could prove so costly. Perhaps next time you'll be more careful.*

Vandalise_19.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_19.text: *Your refusal to pay has done you few favours. It will be left to the guards to loosen your purse strings.*

Vandalise_2.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_2.text: *It seems the owner of that item was rather attached to it. You're about to face the consequences.*

Vandalise_5.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_5.text: *Destruction of property is taken rather seriously around here. Time to defend yourself.*

Vandalise_9.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_9.text: *A witness saw you damaging someone else's property. It seems the guards are about to be called.*

Vandalise_11.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_11.text: *You damaged something that wasn't yours. You sense trouble brewing.*

Vandalise_20.speaker: Player
Vandalise_20.text: Forgive me. I assure you it wasn't intentional.

Vandalise_18.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_18.text: *You manage to calm the situation down. Though next time, it may not be so simple.*

Vandalise_0.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_0.text: *You may want to move on, but the witness doesn't. The guards are on their way.*

Vandalise_16.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_16.text: *Your destructive tendencies have landed you in trouble. It looks like the owner is about to summon the guards.*

Vandalise_21.speaker: Player
Vandalise_21.text: Forgive me. I assure you it wasn't intentional.

Vandalise_8.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_8.text: *Your contrition isn't enough. The guards will decide your punishment.*

Vandalise_10.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_10.text: *You should save your arguments for the guards. It's getting you nowhere at the moment.*

Theft_3.speaker: Narrator
Theft_3.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

Theft_17.speaker: Narrator
Theft_17.text: *You won't be allowed to get away with that. Swift and violent retribution is headed your way...*

Theft_11.speaker: Narrator
Theft_11.text: *Stealing in plain view was a bold move. That confidence will come in handy when the guards arrive.*

Theft_6.speaker: Narrator
Theft_6.text: *You've been caught in the act. So much for the perfect crime.*
Theft_6.context: InternalNodeContext: A player stole an item while an NPC witnessed this.

Theft_8.speaker: Narrator
Theft_8.text: *No harm done, save for any pride you take in your thieving skills.*

Theft_16.speaker: Narrator
Theft_16.text: *With your ill-gotten gains discarded, the accusation fizzles away.*

Theft_14.speaker: Player
Theft_14.text: Hold firm. What was taken is now yours.

Theft_15.speaker: Narrator
Theft_15.text: *Your defiance holds little sway. Your thievery will be rectified, though you may not live to see it.*

Theft_5.speaker: Narrator
Theft_5.text: *Your refusal has done you few favours. The guards are being summoned.*

Theft_7.speaker: Player
Theft_7.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

Theft_12.speaker: Narrator
Theft_12.text: *The accusation falters. Nothing can be found to hold against you.*

KnockSpell_2.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_2.text: *Tampering with that lock might be the last thing you ever do. This witness will make sure of that.*
KnockSpell_2.context: NodeContext: This node will start combat

KnockSpell_4.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_4.text: *It seems that little spell just earned you a meeting with the guards.*

KnockSpell_7.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_7.text: *The lock you tampered with remains intact. The same may not be true of you, once this guard decides your punishment.*

KnockSpell_16.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_16.text: *Prison guards rarely take kindly to prisoners tampering with locks. This one is no exception.*
KnockSpell_16.context: NodeContext: This node will start combat

KnockSpell_17.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_17.text: *That spell usually results in a lock being opened. Unfortunately, this time it's about to get you locked up.*

KnockSpell_3.speaker: Player
KnockSpell_3.text: Try to talk your way out.

KnockSpell_22.speaker: Player
KnockSpell_22.text: I'm a locksmith! You really want to arrest me for doing my job?

KnockSpell_0.speaker: Player
KnockSpell_0.text: Back off. Or I'll use your bones for lockpicks instead.

KnockSpell_11.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_11.text: *You've successfully persuaded the guard that you belong in a cell.*

KnockSpell_12.speaker: Player
KnockSpell_12.text: The lock is still intact. No harm done, is there?

KnockSpell_8.speaker: Player
KnockSpell_8.text: Take this and let's have no more unpleasantness. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

KnockSpell_13.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_13.text: *Your gold was more than enough to defuse the situation. You're free to go.*

KnockSpell_20.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_20.text: *It's customary to possess gold in order to bribe someone with it.*

KnockSpell_24.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_24.text: *Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*

KnockSpell_5.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_5.text: *Your gold is of little interest. It won't buy your freedom this time.*

KnockSpell_19.speaker: Narrator
KnockSpell_19.text: *One little spell and this child's telling on you. Spoilsport.*
KnockSpell_19.context: NodeContext: Thirrd warning for Civilians: call guards, or regular warning again.

UseForbiddenItem_0.speaker: Narrator
UseForbiddenItem_0.text: *Not everyone subscribes to 'what is mine is yours', it seems.*
UseForbiddenItem_0.context: NodeContext: Second warning as civilian (= first warning as civilian with a few additions from the second batch, because no final warnings as civilian)

MovedCorpse_0.speaker: Narrator
MovedCorpse_0.text: *Moving a corpse is one way to get attention. It seems this is a hobby best indulged privately.*
MovedCorpse_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Consider NOT_MESSING_AROUND and GOBLIN_KID characters as permanently angry in this context

MovedCorpse_3.speaker: GROUP_Bugbear, GROUP_Constructs, GROUP_Daisy, GROUP_Demons, GROUP_Desire, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Gnolls, GROUP_Gnomes, GROUP_Goblins, GROUP_HalfElves, GROUP_Halflings, GROUP_Hobgoblin, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Ogres, GROUP_Origins, GROUP_SmartUndead, GROUP_Tiefling, GROUP_Trolls
MovedCorpse_3.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

MovedCorpse_5.speaker: Narrator
MovedCorpse_5.text: *You were seen moving a corpse. It seems the punishment is a swift and bloody death of your own.*

MovedCorpse_4.speaker: Narrator
MovedCorpse_4.text: *You were seen trying to move a body. You're being reported.*

MessWithCorpse_0.speaker: Narrator
MessWithCorpse_0.text: *Messing with the dead isn't appreciated. Think twice before doing it again.*
MessWithCorpse_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Consider NOT_MESSING_AROUND and GOBLIN_KID characters as permanently angry in this context

MessWithCorpse_1.speaker: Narrator
MessWithCorpse_1.text: *The dead cannot stop you, but the living can - get ready for a fight.*
MessWithCorpse_1.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

Trespassing_0.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_0.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

Trespassing_21.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_21.text: *This area is strictly off-limits. It seems you're about to learn that the hard way.*

Trespassing_14.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_14.text: *The only thing more foolish than trespassing here is getting caught. You're being reported.*

Trespassing_12.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_12.text: *It seems the rules have not changed in your absence. You're still trespassing.*

Trespassing_5.speaker: Player
Trespassing_5.text: Back the way I came, right?

Trespassing_18.speaker: Player
Trespassing_18.text: Try to convince them you belong here.
Trespassing_18.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

Trespassing_20.speaker: Player
Trespassing_20.text: Why are you looking at me like that? I live here.

Trespassing_24.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_24.text: *Congratulations - you've convinced them to give you access. Now what?*

Trespassing_7.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_7.text: *The only thing you've managed to convince them of is that you absolutely do not belong here.*

Trespassing_17.speaker: Player
Trespassing_17.text: That uniform of yours will make a very tasteful bodybag, if you don't get out of my way.

Trespassing_16.speaker: Player
Trespassing_16.text: I'm here, aren't I? You wouldn't have let me in if I didn't belong, would you?

Trespassing_4.speaker: Player
Trespassing_4.text: Try to buy your way in. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
Trespassing_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Gain permanent access to the trespassing area

Trespassing_2.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_2.text: *Trespassing? What trespassing? You were always welcome here.*

Trespassing_9.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_9.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*

Trespassing_15.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_15.text: *You don't have permission to be here. You're about to be ejected.*

Trespassing_8.speaker: Player
Trespassing_8.text: My humble apologies. I shall remove myself immediately.

DisarmingTrap_0.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_0.text: *It's forbidden to interfere with someone else's trap. The alarm is being raised.*
DisarmingTrap_0.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

DisarmingTrap_1.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_1.text: *You were spotted sabotaging a trap. There's a word for those who try that. Dead.*
DisarmingTrap_1.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

DisarmingTrap_2.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_2.text: *You've been witnessed trying to disarm a trap. This act of hostility will not be tolerated.*
DisarmingTrap_2.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

DisarmingTrap_3.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_3.text: *You hoped it was your good looks inviting attention. Sadly, it was your attempt to disarm that trap. Better leave it alone.*

DisarmingTrap_4.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_4.text: *You're under surveillance. Best leave that trap alone.*

LockPicking_2.speaker: Narrator
LockPicking_2.text: *You'll need more than a lockpick to get yourself out of this - you're being attacked.*
LockPicking_2.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

LockPicking_3.speaker: Narrator
LockPicking_3.text: *Your lockpicking has angered a guard. Prepare to defend yourself.*
LockPicking_3.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

LockPicking_4.speaker: Narrator
LockPicking_4.text: *Whatever's behind that lock, it's being watched closely. Best to step away.*

LockPicking_6.speaker: Narrator
LockPicking_6.text: *Your lockpicking has landed you in trouble. You're being reported.*
LockPicking_6.context: NodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

PlacedTrap_0.speaker: Narrator
PlacedTrap_0.text: *Your magic is drawing the wrong kind of attention. Continue, and there will be trouble.*

PlacedTrap_3.speaker: Narrator
PlacedTrap_3.text: *Such magic is considered a criminal offence - and you're about to face punishment.*
PlacedTrap_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Logic nodeNodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

PlacedTrap_4.speaker: Narrator
PlacedTrap_4.text: *Your magical ward has drawn scrutiny. A repeat offence will have dire consequences.*

Assault_4.speaker: Narrator
Assault_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Logic nodeNodeContext: Greeting needs to be empty. It's used to cut off this flow from the others

Assault_1.speaker: Narrator
Assault_1.text: *You opted for violence - now you'll receive violence in turn.*

Assault_3.speaker: Narrator
Assault_3.text: *Your aggression has gone too far. You're being reported to the guards.*

Assault_5.speaker: Narrator
Assault_5.text: *Your violence is drawing the wrong kind of attention. Keep going, and there might be trouble.*

Assault_6.speaker: Narrator
Assault_6.text: *Your attack has drawn cold scrutiny. Repeating your actions could have dire consequences.*

TeleportPlayer_0.speaker: Narrator
TeleportPlayer_0.text: *Your dramatic exit appears to have brought the conversation to a premature close.*
